page.title: 17FARMING AROUND LAMLASH.
page.content: The type of farming that exists in Lamlash consists mainly of dairy farming with some smaller areas used for arable crops. Lamlash grew as an area for farming due to the quality of the soils which are derived from boulder clays, moraines and old beaches.The farmers favour the climate because Lamlash receives the right amount of rain and it is sheltered from high winds. The farming 'Belt' lies in a diagonal of grid squares parallel with the beach.There is a contrast in the type of farming that takes place in the northern areas.Here the farming is more concentrated on arable farming, whereas the farming in the southern parts is mainly dairy with some arable crops.
